XIV.8.1.b
.
Legal Basis for the Fugitive Felon Match
38 U.S.C. 5313B
prohibits the payment of
VA benefits to
a beneficiary (including an apportionee) while the beneficiary is a fugitive felon, and
the dependent(s) (including apportionees) of a Veteran while the
Veteran
is a fugitive felon, and
additional
VA benefits to a beneficiary for a
dependent
who is a fugitive felon.
Exception
:  The prohibition of payment under
38 U.S.C. 5313B
does
not
apply to beneficiaries in receipt of Old-Law Pension or Section 306 Pension.
Note
:  Dependent children of a fugitive surviving spouse may continue to receive benefits in their own right.
Reference
:  For more information on the prohibition of payment to fugitive felons, see
38 CFR 3.665(n)
(disability compensation and Dependency and Indemnity Compensation (DIC))
38 CFR 3.666(e)
(pension), and
VAOPGCPREC 7-2002
.
title: M21-1, Part XIV, Chapter 8 - Fugitive Felon Match
